Cell.Data: Peppol: Identifies the specification of content and rules that apply to the transaction.
Peppol: Identifies the BII profile or business process context in which the transaction appears.

BEAst: T0125/T6338, Despatch Advice Number/Order Receipt Number. Peppol: An transaction instance must contain an identifier. The identifier enables positive referencing the document instance for various purposes including referencing between transactions that are part of the same process.
BEAst: T6325, Document Date/Time. Peppol: The date when the despatch advice is issued. Format = "YYYY-MM-DD"
BEAst: T6325, Document Date/Time. Peppol: The time when the despatch advice is issued. Format = "hh:mm:ss"
BEAst: Used for Transport Information (T6008). Peppol: A textual note for the dispatch as whole.
BEAst: T3309/T6335, Order Number/Call Off Reference. Peppol: Used to provide a reference to the order on which the despatch is based.
BEAst: Used for additional BEAst information on header level. Peppol:

BEAst: The reference number of the added information. Can be the Project Number (T6004), Customers' Reference (T6005), Seller's Order Number (T6099), Final Customer's Order Number (T6221), Drawing Number (T6222), Delivery Part (T6340), Freight Payer's Customer Number (T6463) or Document Name (T6484) depending on DocumentType. Peppol: An identifier for the referenced document.

BEAst: The type of reference when a valid code is not possible to use. "FreightPayersCustomerNumber" (T6463), "SellersOrderNumber" (T6099), "FinalCustomersOrderNumber" (T6221), "DeliveryPart" (T6340) or Any other document type (T6473). Peppol: Textual description of the document.

BEAst: The referenced document can here be inserted as a binary object (T6475). Peppol: The attached document embeded as binary object, coded as Base64. The binary object has two supplementary components: a Mime Code, which specifies the Mime type of the attachment and a Filename that is provided by (or on behalf of) the sender of the document
Peppol: The mime code of the attached document.
BEAst: filename refers to T6476. Peppol: The file name of the attached document

BEAst: The Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) that identifies the external object as an Internet resource (T6187). Peppol: The Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) that identifies where the external document is located.

BEAst: This party defines the company that provides the goods or the service. It also defines the sender of the Despatch Advice. The real Ship-from Address must be provided in the Despatch Address when the Despatch Advice describes a movement. Peppol: The Despatch Party is the person or organization who provides (despatch) the goods or services. The role is carried out by the supplier or on behalf of the supplier. (Despatch Party is sometimes known as the Consignor).
Peppol: Identifies the despatch party's electronic address
Peppol: Scheme identifier for electronic address
BEAst: Shipper (T0129) Peppol: The identifier of the despatching party
BEAst: Strongly recommended to use even though it is not mandatory in Peppol. Peppol: Scheme identifier for party identification
Peppol: Postal address of the depatching party
BEAst: Street Name (T5003) Peppol: The main address line in a postal address usually the street name and number.

BEAst: Used for Department (T5002). Peppol: An additional address line in a postal address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line. Common use are secondary house number in a complex or in a building.
BEAst: City Name (T5005) Peppol: The common name of the city where the postal address is. The name is written in full rather than as a code.
BEAst: Postal Code (T6117) Peppol: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.
Peppol: For specifying a region, county, state, province etc. within a country by using text.
BEAst: Used for any other additional address information like Building (T5004). Peppol: An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.

BEAst: Country Code (T5007) Peppol: A code that identifies the country.The lists of valid countries are registered with the ISO 3166-1 Maintenance agency, "Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions". Codes must be according to the alpha-2 representation.
BEAst: Party Name (T5001) Peppol: The name of the dispatching party
BEAst: Name (T5012) Peppol: The name of the contact person.
BEAst: Phone Number (T5010) Peppol: A phone number for the contact person. If the person has a direct number, this is that number.
BEAst: Email Address (T5011) Peppol: The e-mail address for the contact person. If the person has a direct e-mail this is that email.

BEAst: This party defines the company that receives the goods or the service. It also defines the receiver of the Despatch Advice. Peppol: The Consignee is the person or organization to which the products will be shipped and who is taking possession. The role is carried out by the customer or on behalf of the customer.
Peppol: Identifies the consignee party's electronic address
Peppol: Scheme identifier for electronic address
BEAst: Consignee (T0036) Peppol: The receiving party identifier.
BEAst: Strongly recommended to use even though it is not mandatory in Peppol. Peppol: Scheme identifier for party identification
Peppol: Postal address of the consignee
BEAst: Street Name (T5003) Peppol: The main address line in a postal address usually the street name and number.

BEAst: Used for Department (T5002). Peppol: An additional address line in a postal address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line. Common use are secondary house number in a complex or in a building.
BEAst: City Name (T5005) Peppol: The common name of the city where the postal address is. The name is written in full rather than as a code.
BEAst: Postal Code (T6117) Peppol: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.
Peppol: For specifying a region, county, state, province etc. within a country by using text.
BEAst: Used for any other additional address information like Building (T5004). Peppol: An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.

BEAst: Country Code (T5007) Peppol: A code that identifies the country.The lists of valid countries are registered with the ISO 3166-1 Maintenance agency, "Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions". Codes must be according to the alpha-2 representation.
BEAst: Party Name (T5001) Peppol: The name of the receiving party.
BEAst: Name (T5012) Peppol: The name of the contact person.
BEAst: Phone Number (T5010) Peppol: A phone number for the contact person. If the person has a direct number, this is that number.
BEAst: Email address (T5011) Peppol: The e-mail address for the contact person. If the person has a direct e-mail this is that email.
Peppol: The buyer is the legal person or organization who buys or purchases the goods or services. The role is carried out by the customer or on behalf of the customer.
BEAst: Buyer (T0008) Peppol: The buying party identifier
BEAst: Strongly recommended to use even though it is not mandatory in Peppol. Peppol: Scheme identifier for party identification
BEAst: Party Name (T5001) Peppol: The name of the buying party
Peppol: Postal address of the customer
BEAst: Street Name (T5003) Peppol: The main address line in a postal address usually the street name and number.

BEAst: Used for Department (T5002). Peppol: An additional address line in a postal address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line. Common use are secondary house number in a complex or in a building.
BEAst: City Name (T5005) Peppol: The common name of the city where the postal address is. The name is written in full rather than as a code.
BEAst: Postal Code (T6117) Peppol: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.
Peppol: For specifying a region, county, state, province etc. within a country by using text.
BEAst: Used for any other additional address information like Building (T5004). Peppol: An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.

BEAst: Country Code (T5007) Peppol: A code that identifies the country.The lists of valid countries are registered with the ISO 3166-1 Maintenance agency, "Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions". Codes must be according to the alpha-2 representation.
Peppol: The seller is the legal person or organization who sells goods or services to the customer. The role is carried out by the supplier or on behalf of the supplier.
BEAst: Supplier (T0009) Peppol: An identifier for the seller party.
BEAst: Strongly recommended to use even though it is not mandatory in Peppol. Peppol: Scheme identifier for party identification
BEAst: Party Name (T5001) Peppol: The seller party name.
Peppol: Postal address of the supplier
BEAst: Street Name (T5003) Peppol: The main address line in a postal address usually the street name and number.

BEAst: Used for Department (T5002). Peppol: An additional address line in a postal address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line. Common use are secondary house number in a complex or in a building.
BEAst: City Name (T5005) Peppol: The common name of the city where the postal address is. The name is written in full rather than as a code.
BEAst: Postal Code (T6117) Peppol: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.
Peppol: For specifying a region, county, state, province etc. within a country by using text.
BEAst: Used for any other additional address information like Building (T5004). Peppol: An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.

BEAst: Country Code (T5007) Peppol: A code that identifies the country.The lists of valid countries are registered with the ISO 3166-1 Maintenance agency, "Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions". Codes must be according to the alpha-2 representation.
BEAst: For 3PL shipments, this party defines the final receiver of the goods. Peppol:
BEAst: Ultimate Customer ID (T6001 or T6223). Peppol: The originator party identifier.
BEAst: Strongly recommended to use even though it is not mandatory in Peppol. Peppol: Scheme identifier for party identification
BEAst: Ultimate Customer name (T5001). Peppol: The originator party name.
Peppol: Postal address of the originator
BEAst: Street Name (T5003). Peppol: The main address line in a postal address usually the street name and number.
Peppol: An additional address line in a postal address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line. Common use are secondary house number in a complex or in a building.
BEAst: City name (T5005). Peppol: The common name of the city where the postal address is. The name is written in full rather than as a code.
BEAst: Postal code (T6117). Peppol: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.
Peppol: For specifying a region, county, state, province etc. within a country by using text.
Peppol: An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.

BEAst: Country code (T5007). Peppol: A code that identifies the country.The lists of valid countries are registered with the ISO 3166-1 Maintenance agency, "Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions". Codes must be according to the alpha-2 representation.
BEAst: T6127, Freight forwarders referens number Peppol: Identifies a shipment.

BEAst: Used by BEAst for Supplier Remark (T6038). Peppol: Free-form text applying to a shipment. This element may contain notes or any other similar information that is not contained explicitly in another structure.
BEAst: Total Gross Weight (T6472) Peppol: The total weight of the shipment including packaging, as dispatched from the dispatching party.
Peppol: The unit of measure that applies to the shipment quantity.
BEAst: Total Gross Volume (T6494) Peppol: The total volume of the shipment including packaging, as dispatched from the dispatching party.
Peppol: The unit of measure that applies to the shipment volume.
Total number of transport handling units
BEAst: Use a dummy value since this element is mandatory. Peppol: An association to Consignment covering the shipment. Unique number assigned to goods, both for import and export.
BEAst: Used for Vehicle identity number (T6100) Peppol: Description and/or identification of the vehicle that tranpsorts the despatched shipment.
BEAst: Carrier (T3208). Peppol: The carrier party identifier.
BEAst: It is recommended to use the schemeID. Peppol: Scheme identifier for party identification
BEAst: Party Name (T5001) Peppol: The name of the carrier that handles the delivery of the dispatched shipment.
Peppol: Identification about the driver of the vehicle that delivers the despatched shipment.
Peppol: The type of document used for identifying the driver, expressed in text.
BEAst: Transport mode (T6131). Peppol: The mode of transport with which the goods were delivered.
BEAst: Tracking URL (T6737) Peppol: Used to provide a tracking id for delvivery e.g. UPS or postal.
BEAst: Unloading Date and Time (T6372)/Delivery Period Start Date (T6319) Peppol: The start date of the period
BEAst: Unloading Date and Time (T6372)/Delivery Period Start Time (T6734) Peppol: The start time of the period.
BEAst: Delivery Period End Date (T6320) Peppol: The end date of the period.
BEAst: Delivery Period End Time (T6735) Peppol: The end time of the period.
BEAst: Loading Date and Time (T6371)/Despatch Date and Time (T6242) Peppol: The actual or expected date when the shipment was dispatched from the dispatching party.
BEAst: Loading Date and Time (T6371)/Despatch Date and Time (T6242) Peppol: The actual or expected time when the shipment was dispatched from the dispatching party.
BEAst: The Despatch Address is used to define the Ship-from when the Despatch Supplier Party is not. When the Despatch Advice describes a movement, the Despatch Address should be included. Peppol:
BEAst: Identity of the Despatch Address (T0129).
BEAst: Street Name (T5003) Peppol: The main address line in a postal address usually the street name and number.

BEAst: Used for Department (T5002). Peppol: An additional address line in a postal address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line. Common use are secondary house number in a complex or in a building.
BEAst: City Name (T5005). Peppol: The common name of the city where the postal address is. The name is written in full rather than as a code.
BEAst: Postal Code (T6117). Peppol: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.
Peppol: For specifying a region, county, state, province etc. within a country by using text.
BEAst: Used for any other additional address information like Building (T5004). Peppol: An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.

BEAst: Country Code (T5007). Peppol: A code that identifies the country.The lists of valid countries are registered with the ISO 3166-1 Maintenance agency, "Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions". Codes must be according to the alpha-2 representation.
BEAst: Line Number (T0051) Peppol: A indentifier for the individual line in the despatch advice.

BEAst: Transportation Information (T6008) Peppol: General note regarding the despach advice line. Free-form text applying to the Despatch Line. This element may contain notes or any other similar information that is not contained explicitly in another structure.
Mrs Green agreed to waive charge
BEAst: Delivered Quantity (T0070)/Despatched Quantity (T0131). unitCode refers to T6706 Peppol: The quantity that is despatched in the line.
Peppol: The unit of measure that applies to the ordered quantity.
BEAst: Backordered Quantity (T0059). unitCode refers to T6706 Peppol: The quantity outstanding (which will follow in a later shipment).
Peppol: The unit of measure that applies to the ordered quantity.
BEAst: Change Reason Description (T6220) Peppol: The reason for the outstanding quantity.
BEAst: Calloff Line Reference (T6336)/Reference to Order Line (T3322) Peppol: To uniquely identify the line of the order that is being despatched.
BEAst: Reference to the sellers orderline number (T6462). Peppol: To uniquely identify the line of the sales order that is being despatched.
BEAst: Order Number (T3309) Peppol: Identifies the order that the reference order line belongs to.

BEAst: ID of the referenced document or item: Reference to Delivery Note (T0063), Customer's Reference Number (T6005), Offer Number (T6010), Vendor's Order Number (T6099), Ultimate Customer's Order Number (T6221), Drawing Number (T6222), Material Ticket Number (T6329), Material Ticket Reference (T6337), Delivery Unit (T6340), Reference to Web (T6373), Ultimate Customer's Order Line Number (T6458), Offer Line Number (T6466) or Document Name (T6484). Peppol: An identifier for the referenced document.

BEAst: Identifies the type of document or item. ("ReferenceToDeliveryNote", "CustomersReferenceNumber", "OfferNumber", "EndCustomersOrderNumber", "DrawingNumber", "MaterialTicketNumber", "MaterialTicketReference", "DeliveryUnit", "ReferenceToWeb", "EndCustomersOrderLineNumber", "OfferLineNumber", any other type of document or item). Peppol: Textual description of the document.
BEAst: Article Description (T6226) Peppol: A short name for an item.

BEAst: Buyers Part Article Number (T6022)/Article Number (T0172) when T6317="BP"/Littera (T6417). Peppol: An identifier, assigned by the buyer, for the item. Associates the item with its identification according to the buyer's system.
BEAst: Suppliers Article Number (T0172) Peppol: An identifier, assigned by the seller, for the item. Associates the item with its identification according to the seller's system.
Peppol: An extended identifier for the item that identifies the item with specific properties, e.g., Item 123 = Chair / Item 123 Ext 45 = brown chair.
BEAst: Only one Standard Item Number can be used per line. Peppol:

BEAst: Global Trade Item Number (T0154) or RSK Article Number Sweden (T6023). All other item number standards used within BEAst can not be used here until the organisation behind the standard decides to be a part of the codelist "ISO 6523 ICD". These are: NOBB Article Number (T6027), RT Article Number (T6460), TUN Article Number (T6028), Finfo/Vilma Article Number (T6029), Norwegian RSK Article Number (T6024), Norwegian E-number (T6026), E-number (T0260) and SGTIN (T6461). Peppol: An item identifier based on a registered scheme. Associates the item with its identification according to a standard system.
Item standard identifier identification scheme identifier
Peppol: The identification scheme identifier of the Item standard identifier
Peppol: with specific properties, e.g., Item 123 = Chair / Item 123 Ext 45 = brown chair.

BEAst: Used to classify the material when the item number is not sufficient (T6466), to inform about the source of classification standard (T6467) and to provide standard branch codes for the items. The Reference to Article Class (T6466) is the ItemClassificationCode, listID = "ZZZ", listVersionID = BEAST:4.0" and name is Source to Classification (T6467). Peppol: A code for classifying the item by its type or nature. Classification codes are used to allow grouping of similar items for a various purposes e.g. public procurement (CPV), e-Commerce (UNSPSC) etc.
Item classification identifier identification scheme identifier

BEAst: For Item Classification Codes that are found in UNCL7143, select the correct code and leave listVersionID and name empty. For construction specific list that are not a part of UNCL7143 yet ListID must always be "ZZZ" and listVersionID "BEAST:4.0", i.e. mutually agreed. Peppol: The identification scheme identifier of the Item classification identifier
Item classification identifier version identification scheme identifier
Peppol: The identification scheme version identifier of the Item classification identifier
Clear text name equivalent of classification code

BEAst: If construction specific lists are used, name specifies which of them is used. Possible names are: "SBMI", "SA", "AI", “ME” and "CoClass”. "SBMI" = Sveriges Bergmaterialindustrier, "SA" = Sveriges Åkeriföretag, "AI" = Återvinningsindustrierna, “ME” = Maskinentreprenörerna. Peppol: The textual equivalent of the code value
BEAst: Dangerous Goods Code (T0169) Peppol: The identifier assigned to transportable hazardous goods by the United Nations, expressed as a code.

BEAst: Dangerous Goods, Hazard Code (T0263) Peppol: Identifies a hazard class applicable to dangerous goods as defined by the relevant regulation authority, such as the IMDG Class Number of the SOLAS Convention ofIMO and the ADR/RID Class Number for the road/rail environment.

BEAst: This group is also in BEAst used for ConfigurationValue (T6369), GUID Identifier (T6408), Treatment code (T6468), Alternative Vehicle Type (T6339), EPD data, NeC additional information about Asphalt and Concrete, Price information and Rental additional information. Peppol: A group of business terms providing information about properties of the goods and services invoiced.

BEAst: Product Group Code (T0011), Property Name (T6446), Product Type Description (T6442). When the NameCode is used, the name can be set to "NA" since it is mandatory to have. Peppol: The name of the property.The name must be sufficiently descriptive to define the value. The definition may be supplemented with the property unit of measure when relevant.

BEAst: "ConfigurationValue", "GUIDIdentifier", "TreatmentCode", "AlternativeVehicleType", "EPDDataSetID", "EPDDataSetURL", "EPDPDFURL", "ResourceID", "Price" or "Rental". Property ID NeC (T6469), Property ID Type (T6443), Identity Type Code (T6440). listID refers to Property ID (T6444) but is always "BEAST:4.0" when NameCode is any of the fix values defined here. Peppol: Code for the item property according to a property code system.
Peppol: An identifier for the code list used for the Name code, this is bilaterally agreed

BEAst: Price Amount (T6235), Alternative Vehicle Type (T6339), Configuration Value (T6369), GUID Identifier (T6408), Property Class ID (T6441), Property Value (T6452), Treatment Code (T6468), EPD data, Resource ID, Rental Indicator (T6477) or Article Property (T6470). The Rental Indicator (T6477) is changed from "True"/"False" to "Rental"/"Purchase". Peppol: The value of the item property.

BEAst: Property Compare Code (T6457), Price Unit Basis Quantity (T6722). unitCode refers to Measure Unit NeB Type (T6706). Peppol: The unit of measure in which the property value is stated, if relevant. May not be relevant when properties are descriptive.
Peppol: The unit of measure that applies to the value quantity.
BEAst: Property Value ID (T6450), Price Specification Code (T6721). Peppol: Standardized and predefined classification of items properties.
BEAst: Production or Manufacture Date (T0262) Peppol: The manufacturing date of all items listed in this dispatch line.
BEAst: Best Before Date (T3276) Peppol: The best before date of all items listed in this dispatch line.
BEAst: Serial Number (T3236) Peppol: Serial numbers for items listed in the dispatch line.
BEAst: Batch Number (T0132). Peppol: The batch number that applies to all items in the dispatch line.
Peppol: The expiry date of all items listed in this dispatch line.
Peppol: Element is mandated by syntax structure use value NA
BEAst: This group is used when it is possible to describe the content of the Transport Handilng Units. Peppol:
BEAst: The SSCC identification code of this Transport Handling Unit (T0138). Peppol: Identifies the transport handling unit.

BEAst: Type of Transport Handling Unit (T6119). Use UN/ECE Recommendation 21 with addition of the codes used by "Retursystem Byggpall". Peppol: The type of packaging that represent the handling unit, such as box, pallet, container etx.
Peppol: Indicates whether the shipment contains hazardous materials.
Peppol: Free-form description of the marks and numbers on a transport unit or package.
BEAst: To describe the type of measurement (T6714). Use UNCL 6313 subset. Peppol: Code to indicate if the measure is gross weight or gross volume
Handling unit gross weight or handling unit gross volume

BEAst: For the measure (T6122) and Measure of Unit Code (T6706). Use UN/ECE Recommendation 20 and 21. subset. Peppol: Handling gross weight, including packaging as dispatched by dispatching party.Handling gross volume, including packaging as dispatched by dispatching party.
Handling unit gross weight or volume unit of measure
Peppol: The unit of measure that applies to the handling unit gross weight or to the handling unit gross volume.
BEAst: Unique identity of the package (T0138). Peppol: An identifier for this package
BEAst: Type of Package (T6119). Use UN/ECE Recommendation 21 with addition of the codes used by "Retursystem Byggpall". Peppol: The type of packaging used, such as box, pallet, container etx.
